member.summary: Converts the value of the specified object to its equivalent string representation.
member.param: The Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) to convert.
member.returns: A RFC 822 string representation of the value of the .
member.exception: The specified object does not represent a Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) value.

member.name: M:PodcastUtilities.Common.Rfc822DateTime.TryParse(System.String,System.DateTime@)
member.summary: Converts the specified string representation of a date and time to its equivalent.
member.param: A string containing a date and time to convert.

When this method returns, contains the value equivalent to the date and time contained in , expressed as Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), if the conversion succeeded, or MinValue if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the s parameter is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), or does not contain a valid string representation of a date and time. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if the parameter was converted successfully; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The string is parsed using formatting information in the object.

member.name: P:PodcastUtilities.Common.Rfc822DateTime.Rfc822DateTimeFormat
member.summary: Gets the custom format specifier that may be used to represent a in the RFC 822 format.
member.value: A DateTime format string that may be used to represent a in the RFC 822 format.

remarks.para: This method returns a string representation of a that utilizes the time zone offset (local differential) to represent the offset from Greenwich mean time in hours and minutes. The is a valid date-time format string for use in the method.

The RFC 822 Date and Time specification specifies that the year will be represented as a two-digit value, but the RSS Profile recommends that all date-time values should use a four-digit year. The class follows the RSS Profile recommendation when converting a to the equivalent RFC 822 string representation.
